column4: does ubuntu not come with a c++ compiler installed by default or am I just being a huge nub?
you're not being a nub, you are being correct :(
that honestly and seriously shocks me... why not? lol
ubuntu is a user's OS not a developer's OS
I use ubuntu
and do you know no other devs?
because I know that I use ubuntu, I don't care what others use
which college do you attend?
CUNY :(
you do not like it?
it's meh
I learn, but they are outdated ... barely any linux/unix and no .NET and no nice web dev stuff (AJAX and stuff like that)
I'm going to Georgia Tech in the fall, not sure what they use up there
Stephon Marbury went there ...
who's that? :)
C/C++/Java are not the world
learn to do what?
I managed to break fedora 5 3 times by removing stuff
you want to learn? get gentoo
lfs/gentoo teaches a lot ... you do shoot yourself in the head later though
I say start using ubuntu
after you get confortable, then get something more extreme like gentoo
whatever it is, pick one
all linux distros are similar in that they do similar things differently
